page.title: 12FORESTRY CONTINUED
page.content: Delamere/Eddisbury {FORESTRY CONTINUED Education continued. Fox Howl Outdoor Education Centre is run by Cheshire Education Authority. The building used to be a Youth Hostel from about 1933 to 1973, when it became the O.E.C. Its catchment area is Cheshire & it caters for all age groups from first schools to college groups,also teachers courses & adult education courses. The centre operates at approx.8000 visitor days per year. Currently one of its projects is WATCH a National Environmental Club for children. Delamere Forest School is at the north-eastern corner of our area.It was founded as a 'fresh air' school for children from Manchester. Today its function is similar & it is well known for the opportunities it avails.
